Content-Type: text/plain; charset="windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

(apologies for cross-posting)

** 13th International Conference on Parallel=
 Problem Solving from Nature (
PPSN 2014) **
September 13-17, 2014, Ljublja=
na, Slovenia
Organized by the Jozef Stefan Institute
http://ppsn2014.ijs.si=


You are invited to submit your workshop or tutorial proposals. The
worksh=
ops and tutorials will be held in conjunction with the International
Confer=
ence on Parallel Problem Solving from Nature (PPSN 2014).

** Important Dat=
es **

* Workshop proposal submission: November 18, 2013
* Tutorial proposa=
l submission: November 18, 2013
* Notification of acceptance of workshop pr=
oposals: December 18, 2013
* Notification of acceptance of tutorial proposa=
ls: December 18, 2013


** WORKSHOP Proposals **

The PPSN 2014 Organizing =
Committee invites proposals for workshops to be
held in conjunction with PP=
SN 2014. Proposals are due November 18, 2013.
The workshops are intended to=
 be forums for presenting and discussing new
approaches, visions, or critic=
al reflections within a subfield. They
provide an excellent opportunity to =
meet people with similar interests, to
be exposed to cutting-edge research,=
 and to exchange ideas in an informal
setting. The organizers of an accepte=
d workshop are responsible for its
coordination, publicity, collecting and =
reviewing the papers/abstracts, and
for maintaining a webpage providing a l=
ist of accepted talks. The workshops
can be half day or a full day long. At=
tendance at the workshops will be
free of charge for all PPSN 2014 attendee=
s. For detailed information see
http://ppsn2014.ijs.si/?show=3Dcfw.

** Pro=
posal Preparation **

A workshop proposal should include:
* title of the wo=
rkshop
* brief description of the workshop topics
* potential target partic=
ipants and audience
* roughly approximated number of participants
* rough e=
stimate of the number of talks
* contact details and a short CV of the orga=
nizer(s)

** Reviewing **

Workshop proposals will be reviewed by the PPSN =
2014 Workshop Chairs and
PPSN 2014 Organizing Committee, based on expected =
PPSN attendees=92 interest,
depth of the topics, and the expertise of the w=
orkshop organizers.

** Information and Submissions **

Workshop Chairs: Ev=
ert Haasdijk, VU University Amsterdam, The Netherlands,
and Tea Tusar, Joze=
f Stefan Institute, Slovenia
Email: ppsn2014@...


** TUTORIAL Proposals=
 **

The PPSN 2014 Organizing Committee invites proposals for tutorials.
Pr=
oposals are due November 18, 2013. The tutorial topic should enjoy broad
in=
terest within the community. It can be an established or emerging
research =
topic within the field itself, but also from a related research
field or ab=
out an interesting application area. The proposed topic should
be broad eno=
ugh to provide a gentle introduction to the research area, but
it should al=
so cover the most important contributions in depth. The planned
duration of=
 the tutorials is two hours. Attendance at the tutorials will be
free of ch=
arge for all PPSN 2014 attendees. For detailed information, see
http://ppsn=
2014.ijs.si/?show=3Dcft.

** Proposal Preparation **

A tutorial proposal s=
hould include:
* title of the tutorial
* brief abstract
* a tutorial descri=
ption in syllabus form
* lecturers' names, addresses, emails, and short CVs=

* potential target participants and audience

** Reviewing **

Tutorial pr=
oposals will be reviewed by the PPSN 2014 Tutorial Chairs and
PPSN 2014 Org=
anizing Committee, based on expected PPSN attendees=92 interest,
depth of t=
he topics, and the expertise of the tutorial organizers.

** Information an=
d Submissions **

Tutorial Chairs: Shih-Hsi "Alex" Liu, California State Un=
iversity, Fresno,
USA, and Marjan Mernik, University of Maribor, Slovenia
E=
mail: ppsn2014@...

********

-- 
Computational Intelligence Group
Compu=
ter Science Department
Faculty of Sciences - VU University Amsterdam
De Boe=
lelaan 1081a, room T3.41
1081 HV  Amsterdam, The Netherlands

T. +31 (0)20 =
59 87668
M. +31 (0)6 2242 3598

VU-disclaimer:
http://www.vu.nl/nl/over-de-=
vu/vu-website/e-mail-disclaimer/disclaimer-tekst-e-mail/
